etymology.description: semantic 言 (“speech”) + phonetic 司; simplified from 詞 (言 → 讠).
etymology.interpretation: Combines the speech element 言/讠 with the phonetic 司, signaling a meaning related to spoken language while borrowing its sound from 司. The form points to utterances or expressions, aligning with senses like “word” and “lyrics.”
etymology.simplification: Component reduction in the PRC script reform: the semantic component 言 was contracted to 讠 on the left side; the phonetic 司 remained unchanged.

examples.chinese: 这个词很难理解(這個詞很難理解)。
examples.english: This word is hard to understand.
